  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 6 x 1 L glass bottles of Cyclohexane 1 x 1 L glass bottle was found broken and leaked all content ( 1 L ) out package had paper and molded foam no slotted partitions , bags or absorbent was found . Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024070487
item.description:
Report E-2024070487

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When moving freight to load into trailer material handler noticed a jerrican staged on a pallet slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation revealed that a nail from the pallet had punctured the bottom of the pallet contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

item.title: Report E-2024070488
item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While carrying an oversize piece a freight across the dock, material handler struck a drum that was already staged on the dock with the oversized piece of freight consequently puncturing the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report X-2024071035
item.description:
Report X-2024071035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-07
  • City: Linwood
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At the ZTYR location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained five metal jerrycans packaged in plastic bags and bubble wrap for dunnage. One of the jerrycans had a damaged bottom chime causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024071056
item.description:
Report X-2024071056

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET RIPPED TORN OPEN AND LEAKING PACKAGE FOUND ON TRAILER #561314 ALREADY DAMAGED RIPPED TORN WET AND LEAKING UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF MURIATIC ACID FOR SWIMMING POOLS AND SPAS ONE 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .25 GALLONS TO RELEASE PACKAGE DID HAVE STYROFOAM PEANUTS BUT NO SLOTTED PARTITIONS BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

Couldn't find the actual SDS for this particular item, but found an SDS that is similar with the same DOT transportation information.

item.title: Report E-2024070437
item.description:
Report E-2024070437

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: BROCKWAY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Our tanker vehicle loaded full with 87 Gasoline was struck by another vehicle. Our trailer required to be towed. Before it was towed the damaged trailer was emptied by a third party company with a pumping truck, into an empty secondary tanker we had brought onto location. In the events of the pumping truck transferring the product, the pumping company did not verify that all of the product was transferred from one tank of the damaged truck to the corresponding tank of the new truck. In doing so, our 1100 gallon tank was overfilled and 20 gallons of gasoline was pushed out of the vapor recovery line on our trailer. The third party company used absorbent mats, brooms, absorbent socks, and clean up powder to mitigate the effects of the release.
